main event: A sighting of bright silver aerial objects that did not resemble airplanes, helicopters, or birds occurred on 23 April 1963 in Gloucester, Massachusetts.
interesting points: The sighting took place in the morning and lasted for about 5-10 minutes., The objects were described as bright silver in color and glowing., The observer concluded the objects did not conform to any known aircraft., An additional sighting mention in Manchester on April 22 describes smaller circular objects proceeding to a central disc., The report suggests the objects might be balloons, highlighting the need for more information.
witness description: An observer noted the objects' unusual appearance and flight characteristics.
